events.name: Dart Flight School Hamburg
events.description:
Agenda:

18:00 Dart TechTalk von Sven Reinck

19:00-20:00 Codelab Teil I von Sven Reinck und Marco Pöhler

Im ersten Teil des Codelabs werden wir das PirateBadge Tutorial von der Dart-Webseite durchgehen, welches eine kleine clientseitige Anwendung zeigt. 

20:00-21:00 Codelab Teil II von Sven Reinck und Marco Pöhler

Im zweiten Teil werden wir eine Dart-Anwendung auf einen Server spielen. Der Fokus liegt im zweiten Teil auf der serverseitigen Programmierung. (Wir nehmen für die Server Heroku)

Das Ziel dieser Codelabs ist, dass das wir alle die Beispiele auf  unseren eigenen Laptops hinbekommen. Wir werden uns dazu gegenseitig helfen. Wenn Du dran teilnehmen möchtest, musst Du also deinen Laptop mitbringen und am besten schonmal den Dart-Editor runterladen: 

https://www.dartlang.org/tools/editor/

Sven Reinck ist freiberuflicher Trainer für Programmiersprachen und arbeitet für verschiedene Firmen und Schulen. Wenn Du einen Trainer in eurer Firma braucht, zögert nicht ihn anzusprechen.

Marco Pöhler ist Java Freelancer. Er betreibt ein paar eigene Seite wie http://www.kontaktlinsen-preisvergleich.de um neue Dinge auszuprobieren.﻿

events.name: Google BigQuery
events.description:
BigQuery = Run fast, SQL-like queries against multi-terabyte datasets in seconds. Scalable and easy to use, BigQuery gives you real-time insights about your data.

Agenda

20:00 - 20:15 Opening talk - A guest from the business side of google will tell us how businesses use big data.

20:15 - 21:00 Felipe Hoffa (https://plus.google.com/u/1/+FelipeHoffa , @felipehoffa) Developer Programs Engineer for Cloud and Big Data from Google, San Francisco, will give us an Introduction to BigQuery including the latest updates. Session ends with Q&A.

21:00 - 21:30 Hands on! Bring your Laptops with you and learn how to use BigQuery and run some interactive queries!

• Language will be english

• Location: XING AG, Dammtorstrasse 29-32, Hamburg, 5th Floor, Eventroom

events.name: Google IO Extended 2014
events.description:
Wie jedes Jahr wollen wir gemeinsam die Keynote von der Google IO per Livestream ansehen.  Wir werden danach auch wieder versuchen einen Hangout mit Teilnehmern hinzubekommen.

...und ich darf ankündigen, dass die ersten Leute die kommen auch diese wunderschönen T-Shirts bekommen ;-)

events.name: GDG Drinks
events.description:
Summer is fading away, but the GDGs are not!

GDG Hamburg, GDG Hamburg Golang and GDG Hamburg Android invite for a get together with all 3 regional Google Developer Groups.

You and your favourite technology are not alone is this city! Take a look over your own area of expertice and get to know crazy web-heroes, green mobile developers, awesome DevOp-ninjas and even more developers from all over Hamburg!

Join us for a meet & greet with like-minded people, fun, food and some drinks!

Because in the end we are all just developers with a common interest in Google technologies!

events.name: LocationTech Meetup
events.description:
LocationTech is a working group developing advanced location aware technologies.

This LocationTech Meetup is a chance to meet members, project developers, entrepreneurs, and other interesting people for an enjoyable evening of good food, drinks, and camraderie. The evening will feature presentations from advanced open source technology projects.

---

Bei dieser Abendveranstaltung habt Ihr die Chance Mitglieder, Entwickler, Unternehmen und andere interessierte Leute zu treffen. Kernthema dabei sind Open Source Software basierte Lösungen, die mit räumliche Daten arbeiten, diese analysieren und präsentieren. Andrew Ross und Ralph Müller von der werden für Fragen rund um die Eclipse Foundation/LocationTech IWG zur Verfügung stehen. Um das Event so angenehm wie möglich zu gestalten, werden wir Getränke kaltgestellt haben und leckere Canapès auftischen.

Agenda:
5:30 Get Together
6:00 Opening / Welcome
6:15 - 7:45 Demos / Talks
7:45 - 8:30 break / Social Networking
8:30 - 10:00 Demos / Talks

You need to register at eventbrite: http://www.eventbrite.ca/e/locationtech-meetup-hamburg-tickets-12166226511

events.name: Google DevFest 2014 @XING
events.description:
The Google DevFest is comming to Hamburg! A full day of talks about Google stuff. Listen, ask, discuss and drink beer with us!

Registration is required here: http://gdghamburg.github.io/devfest/

(Site is under heavy development, Call for Papers is already open)

events.name: Android Meetup - Top Tools Edition
events.description:
For this meetup we won't have just one guy standing in front doing a big presentation, but plan to involve you the community a bit more. 

In the daily work of developing Android apps, using external libraries and tools is a no brainer! Lets exchange our knowledge here a bit.

Which are your favourite libraries, tools or best practices you can't work without anymore?


No slides or thought out presentations needed, when you like a lib or tool and can tell us in a few sentences what it does: perfect! ...and when you can show it in a small demo or on Github, even better!

Because good stuff is there to be shared! ;)

(PS: we recently got hands on some exemplars of a certain gadget made out of paper, which we will give out to everyone who presents something, as long as supply lasts)

events.name: Android Meetup - RxJava in practice
events.description:
Our main talk is a contribution by  talk is Dmitry Zaytsev, it's titled "RxJava in practice":

Here is his abstract: "Although there were plenty of RxJava talks not so many of them were applicable to Android development or were too abstract to justify switching to reactive approach. During this talk you'll see how RxJava can be applied to Android and why you should do it. We'll start with quick introduction and then jump directly to practical problems - something beyond getting list of POJOs from server."

Also we will have a lightning talk by Franziska Neumeister­. It's a short introductionary talk about setting up a test environment with Robolectric, JUnit 4 and the new unit test support in Android Studio 1.1.

There is still room for more short lightning talks. Just reach out to us, if you're interested to present something.

events.name: Android Meetup - What's new in Android testing?
events.description:
We will have a live Hangout with Stephan Linzner, who is a Android developer advocate @ Google in London. He will give the following talk:

What's new in Android Testing

"Unit Test Support in Gradle, the new Android Testing Support Library , Espresso 2.1, JUnit4 …everyone talks of testing in 2015 ! We will review what is new and what is coming from Google. Happy Testing!"

So come and join us to learn about what's hot and new in Android testing and maybe ask the question you always wanted to get solved when it comes to Espresso and testing for Android in general!

(Sorry for the late announcement, but we had some location problems to solve: Thx a lot to Xing for helping out on short notice!)

events.name: Google IOExtended 2015 - Day 1 (Keynote+2 Sessions)
events.description:
>> This is the official registration!

Streaming of the keynote starts at 18:30 (9:30am pacific time) and ends 20:30. According to the schedule there is a 1 hour lunchbreak after the keynote. We are going to bridge the time with some drinks ;-)

The first session (21:30-22:00) will be “Anyone can do it! Easy ways to evaluate your App’s Accessibility” 

The second session (22:00-23:00) will be “What's new in Android”

We think that the schedule is not really final now, so changes are always possible, especially when it comes to "top-secret" topics ;-)

events.name: Google IOExtended 2015 - Day 2 (Codelabs)
events.description:
>> This is the official registration!

We plan to have four different 2-hour codelab sessions with topics like Go, Android and Web-stuff. A codelab means that you bring your own laptop with you and we guide you thru your first steps with a particular google technology. No preparation is needed. There are limited seats of approx. 15 attendees per session. Because we start in the lunchtime, snacks will be provided.

events.name: Google IOExtended 2015 - Day 2 (Sessions)
events.description:
>> This is the official registration!

We will watch sessions from the schedule here (the ones with the camera-icon will be streamed): https://events.google.com/io2015/schedule#day2/

We think that the schedule is not really final now, so changes are always possible, especially when it comes to "top-secret" topics ;-)

events.name: GDG Drinks
events.description:
GDG Hamburg, GDG Hamburg Golang and GDG Hamburg Android invite for a get together with all 3 regional Google Developer Groups.

You and your favourite technology are not alone is this city! Take a look over your own area of expertice and get to know crazy web-heroes, green mobile developers, awesome DevOp-ninjas and even more developers from all over Hamburg!
Join us for a meet & greet with like-minded people, fun, food and some drinks!

Because in the end we are all just developers with a common interest in Google technologies!

events.name: Android Meetup - shiny and secure
events.description:
Google I/O is two months ago already, time to catch up with at least some of all these new APIs that came with it!

Specifically we will have two talks: something for the UI- and for the privacy enthusiastic Android developer!

First, Matthias Friedrich (Android Developer @ Jimdo) will talk about the Android Design Support Library.

The second presentation will be held by Daniel Hartwich (Android Developer @ Xing) and has the title: New App Permissions in Android M. Am I allowed to do that?! 

So, see you end of August!

events.name: Android Meetup - high-performance networking
events.description:
Most mobile apps are nothing without a network connection. This meetup we are focusing on high-performance networking and will have 2 related presentations:

Doug Sillars who is Technical Lead for Performance at AT&T in the US and guest in our beautiful city will tell us about:
High Performance Apps: Easy Tips for Speed, Power and Data 
"In today's competitive mobile application market - your application needs to stand out. However, standing out as a slow app that kills your customer's battery is not good. In this presentation, we'll look at simple ways to profile your application for performance issues, and how you can resolve them before your customers become aware that they exist."

The second talk comes from Rocco Bruno, Android Developer at Xing and has the new GCMNetworkManager as topic.

So does that sound like a interesting event to you? We hope so and to see you mid of September!

events.name: Android Meetup - sharp & playful
events.description:
Let's meet again to exchange and listen to some interesting Android development topics. This time around we will meet at Cellular and have 2 tech talks:

André Tietz (Android developer at myTaxi)

Dagger 2 - Dependency Injection on Android

Richard Schattauer (Android developer at Cellular)

Using the Google Play Games API

Start integrating popular gaming features in your mobile games and web games by using the Google Play games services APIs.


Sounds good? Fine, see you mid of October!

events.name: DevFest Hamburg 2015 - Codelabs
events.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: 

This is not the official registration! To attend you need to register under: 

https://goo.gl/YNpQ1u

The biggest Google tech conference in norther Germany carefully crafted for you by the GDG's of Hamburg! All the latest about Android, Web and Cloud.

On this 1st day we will start in the early afternoon and focus completely on workshops/codelabs around mobile- and the web technologies. You will need to bring your own Laptop to participate. Exact codelabs will be announced shortly. Beacons anyone? ;)

More info under: http://devfest.de/

events.name: DevFest Hamburg 2015 - ConferenceDay
events.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: This is not the official registration! To attend you need to register under: 
https://goo.gl/YNpQ1u

The biggest Google tech conference in norther Germany carefully crafted for you by the GDG's of Hamburg! All the latest about Android, Web and Cloud.

The 2nd day starts early in the morning for us and brings 2 parallel conference tracks dedicated to Android/Mobile and Web/Cloud.
This year we plan for roughly 200 participants of Google technologies interested people like you!
After a smaller DevFest last year at Xing (thx for that!), we need a bigger venue this time! So we were able to arrange something with the Betahaus Hamburg, a central and very well known event location here in Hamburg.

For details like speakers and talks please have a look at: http://devfest.de/

events.name: Code the road - Google Maps Hackathon
events.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: 

This is not the official registration! To attend you need to register under: goo.gl/bktWV8

Ubilabs and the Google Maps team invite you to put your developer and creative skills to use at a 24-hour hackathon. We’re coming together to develop innovative solutions to lend a hand in the Syrian Refugee Crisis. During this 24-hour hackathon, you will work with other developers to brainstorm how existing platforms like Crisis Info Hub, Refugee Maps and more can be expanded and improved and reach even more people impacted by the crisis.

You bring your ideas and hacking skills while Ubilabs and the Google Maps team provide the development platforms, meals, snacks and (of course) caffeinated beverages to keep you going. To help inspire your creativity, you’ll hear from local NGOs on what they are doing to help the crisis, Google team members who have created platforms to help different global initiatives and map and geolocation technology experts.

More information and registration: goo.gl/bktWV8

events.name: Android Meetup - AndDevSummit Extended
events.description:
Let's gather and watch the Android Dev Summit live from Mountain View together! 
The summits agenda can be found here: https://androiddevsummit.withgoogle.com/

Streaming starts at 6pm (which is 9am PST).

Join us this evening when you want some interesting program and a good chat with other Android developers!

events.name: Polymer - Merging the physical and digital world.
events.description:
Sandro Kock (SSV Software Systems GmbH, Hannover) is giving a talk about his experiences with polymer 1.0

Polymer is a library to create and develop custom HTML element, both visual and non-visual. Current Web browsers are far more capable than just displaying static pages, asynchronous requests changed how content is added or manipulated on demand. With just an element of <mqtt-elements> a Web-Application can add the functionality to receive push notifications when the underlining data model changes. This talk will highlight some non-visual elements and give an insight how a library like MQTT.js is bundled into custom HTML elements. 

For this talk a demo application »maps-chat« was created to demonstrate and explain how elements can be meshed together to build a business specific application.

events.name: Android Meetup - Winter is coming...
events.description:
We figured out:
Ned Stark was right, winter is coming.

That's why we decided to do our December meetup on the Christmas Market in front of the town hall.

This will be a social event, so no speakers, only drinkers.
events.how_to_find_us: In front of the main door of the town hall

events.name: Fire in the base!
events.description:
This base is so fast, it's on fire! (Pun intended)

Does the end of Parse mean the end of BaaS (backend as a service) in general? Or is it just that you have to pick the right one?

Join us for a evening dedicated to one of the hottest BaaS solutions out there right now. After that you decide on your own! Our guest will be Frank van Puffelen (Google).

Abstract:

Firebase is the fastest way to build your app. Come and learn how you can build applications quickly without managing complex infrastructure. You'll find out how Firebase's data storage, user management, and asset hosting features work. In addition you'll get to choose, for which platform we'll live-code a chat application. Web? Or Android?

Speaker bio: Frank van Puffelen

Frank is an engineer for Firebase at Google. He helps developers build extraordinary apps that use Firebase as their back-end. If you've ever asked a Firebase question on StackOverflow, you've probably met Frank already.


So, does that sound good for a lausy weathered Saturday in February? Fine, see you then!

events.name: GDG DevFest Hamburg 2016
events.description:
The Hamburg Google Developer Groups together with Women Techmakers are proud to announce the third annual GDG DevFest Hamburg 2016 carefully crafted by the GDG community!

Get your ticket at hamburg.devfest.de

• In 2015 the conference was visited by 275 attendees and 24 speakers from all over Germany!

So hurry up and book your ticket at hamburg.devfest.de


IMPORTANT NOTE: This meetup does not count as official registration.

events.name: Cloud GDG - Migrating to Reactive Microservices
events.description:
Hi everyone,

we thought it is about time to kick-off a new series: the Cloud GDG series. And we are happy that Alexander Thiel, CTO of StyleLounge is taking the lead for the first round. Looking forward to see you there!

Topic Summary:

A centralized data base and various services writing to it: What sometimes makes sense quickly becomes a bottle neck with growing traffic and functionality. Almost all scaling problems are caused by shared data access and its synchronization. For years focus has therefore shifted from vertical to horizontal performance. The time it takes a single function to complete is less relevant than the question whether it can be run concurrently. And that - in most applications - directly depends on how data is stored and accessed.

In this talk I describe a simple migration strategy from monolith to reactive micro services. In addition I give references and insights their theoretical background.

Bio:

Since his childhood and his first steps in programming he's fascinated by coding and its virtually infinite possibilities. He worked in various startups, learning about all their specific scalability and architecture issues. Since 2015 Alexander manages the great engineers of StyleLounge, the soon-to-be biggest fashion price comparison. As a CTO he's responsible for making the application fast, extensible, clean and above all scalable. If he's not discussing software architecture he's searching for talents for his team or digs into new technologies to keep the current stack (node.js, kubernetes, wercker, TypeScript, Babel, react+redux, redis, BigQuery, Elasticsearch) up-to-date.

Agenda:

19.00: Food&Drinks

19.30: Intro - Christopher Denk

19.40: Talk - Alexander Thiel

20.40: Q&A

21.00: The End:)

events.name: Cloud GDG - StackDriver: From Monitoring to Logging to Error Reporting
events.description:
Hi everyone,

our first Cloud GDG meetup was great fun. As a special guest for our second event we are proud to have Nacho Coloma from Google with us. As a Cloud SE he is the perfect fit to show us what StackDriver is capable of and tell us everything from Monitoring to Logging to error Reporting.

Of course we will start off with GCP news again.

Ubilabs was kind enough to host this event in their beautiful offices.

Agenda will follow...
events.how_to_find_us: Please use the entrance through the backyard (follow the signs)

events.name: Next ’17 Extended - Hamburg (Keynote 1)
events.description:
Be part of whats NEXT for cloud, machine learning, infrastructure and even mobility and devices. 

Cloud NEXT is Google's annual event (cloudnext.withgoogle.com) around cloud and productivity. We will gather to network and watch the opening keynote live from San Francisco.

Learn about what Google Cloud offers today and hear from Google leaders Diane Greene, Sundar Pichai, and Eric Schmidt about Google Cloud's vision for the future. This is a more strategic keynote.

Streaming of the keynote will start at 6pm (9am PST).

We will be in the Google Hamburg Office on the 9th floor.

Looking forward to meet you :)

events.name: Next ’17 Extended - Hamburg (Keynote 2)
events.description:
Be part of whats NEXT for cloud, machine learning, infrastructure and even mobility and devices.

Cloud NEXT is Google's annual event (cloudnext.withgoogle.com) around cloud and productivity. We will gather to network and watch the 2nd keynote live from San Francisco.

Learn more about Google Cloud products, including new launches for GCP and G Suite. Product and engineering leaders will share roadmaps and future product direction. Looking forward to meet you :)

events.description:

23:00 End of official event

events.name: GDG Cloud & Golang @ loodse GmbH
events.description:
It's time for the next GDG Cloud event. This time we will have our first cross MeetUp with the Golang gang. You can register with either group.

Agenda will be announced soon. As you may remember we are giving away a shiny new "Cards Against Humanity" set. Only thing you will have to do to win: Tell us about your favorite announcement of this year's Cloud Next (https://blog.google/topics/google-cloud/100-announcements-google-cloud-next-17/). We'll let the crowd decide who wins at the event.

events.name: Building Conversational Experiences With Actions On Google
events.description:
Open Doors: 19:00

19:30 -> Building Conversational Experiences With Actions On Google

by Peter Friese (Google)

Since we first started using computers, we have dreamt of interacting with them in a more natural, human-like way using spoken language. Advances in machine learning and artificial intelligence have spiked an interest in natural language processing, and building conversational interfaces no longer is a dream, but a reality every developer can use in their own applications.

The problem of recognising spoken input has been largely solved, and the next challenge is how to build compelling user experiences that are modelled after natural human conversation.

In this talk, I will give an introduction to the Google Assistant and how to use Actions on Google to build conversational interfaces for devices with and without screens. We will take a look at how API.AI makes implementing natural language understanding feasible even for non-linguists, and discuss how you can integrate agents with existing backends. In conversation, it's all about being natural, so we will also look at how to create agents that feel like real characters.

Bio: Peter is a Developer Advocate at Google, which means he works with developers around the world to solve real world challenges using (not just) Google's products and APIs. Having moved from London to Hamburg, he appreciates a hot cup of tea to cope with the weather.

events.name: Developing content for the new Google Earth
events.description:
Abstract:
Earlier this year, Google has released a new version of Google Earth for web and mobile. One of Google Earth’s exciting new features is Voyager – a platform for stories around the globe. With Voyager, Google Earth not only takes you to your desired destination, but immerses you into a global adventure where there’s a lot to do, learn, and explore.

For the past year, Ubilabs has been supporting Google in the designing, production and processing of this content. Coming up with unique approaches to storytelling and translating these ideas to Voyager’s functional and visual features has been a challenging experience. Among the content is an interactive special for the 2017 solar eclipse, a series of stories about the Brazilian rainforest, and adaptations of existing Google content like Treks and Streetview Collections. In this presentation we talk about our experiences of developing Voyager stories: the need for new storytelling approaches, technical challenges, and working on a all new product.

About the speaker:
Patrick Mast is project owner at Ubilabs. As part of a team of map geeks he works on bringing mapping solutions to the edge of technology.

Ever since he received is first handheld GPS receiver in the 90s he has been addicted to maps and geolocations: locating himself on the globe, visualising data in a geographic context, gaining new insights by analysing geographical data.
After studying Artificial Intelligence in Amsterdam he came back to Germany to first work in the marine business: locating vessels and analysing their movement around the globe. At Ubilabs he now found his home between like minded people, focussing fully on mapping up the world.

events.name: Mobile Sites Certification Study Jam
events.description:
**What we'll do**
At the Mobile Site Certification Study Jam we will learn together and take the Mobil Site Exam in one day. Some basic web development skills are required. About the Mobile Sites certification:
The Mobile Sites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognizes them as an expert in mobile sites.
(Taken from https://support.google.com/partners/answer/7358898?hl=en)

**What to bring**
Laptop, good mood.

events.name: Let's FLUTTER
events.description:
We are happy to invite you for an evening dedicated to Flutter, Google's new mobile app framework for crafting high-quality native interfaces on Android and iOS.

We are happy to welcome 2 speakers that already have experience with this promising new technology.

Matthias Friedrich is going to talk about the Jimdo mobile team's experience building their latest app with Flutter:

"PRODUCTION FLUTTER'ing

End of 2017 we were about to start work on a completely new app that should lay ground for our whole companies mobile app strategy for the years to come. We decided to join forces of our two existing native mobile app developer teams and use Flutter, Google’s new cross-platform framework for Android and iOS.

Advantages like really well working hot-reload, complete code sharing for both platforms and a modern, reactive ui framework are just too good to be ignored. But Flutter is still in an early state and with that has its teething troubles and also very own shortcomings.

In the first part of this talk I want to share the overall experience we made building our very first Flutter app and running it in production for over 3 months.

The second half then goes full into live coding mode to show one of Flutter’s strengths: the easiness to build a fully customized animated graph, the visual highlight of our still small but beautiful app.

After the talk you hopefully have a better picture of what Flutter is capable of, its state of maturity and which use-cases it’s already great to be taken for."

The second will be held by Brian Egan, early Flutter contributor and DartConf18 speaker:

"BUILD A REACTIVE FLUTTER APP!

Interested in Flutter, but love RxJava and MVI? Curious about how to structure Flutter apps? If so, join along as we explore how to architect apps using using Dart Streams! We'll cover the basics of Streams, how to beef up their power with RxDart, and how to create a Reactive Application with these patterns.

This talk will cover the Bloc pattern introduced by Google. It's similar to MVI, and helps layer your apps, allowing you to write business logic that works flawlessly across three platforms: iOS, Android, and web.

Come learn a bit more about Flutter and the architecture patterns that can help give your apps a testable, reusable, and cohesive structure!"

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts, discover all the different ways in which emerging technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest
Call for papers (until September 15): http://papercall.io/dachfest18

events.name: Flutter Live Viewing Party
events.description:
Together with https://freiheit.com, we would like to invite you all to be part of a viewing party for Flutter - Google’s new Mobile App SDK!

On December 4th at 5:00 PM, we will be hosting Flutter Live at Freiheit.com where Google will share a variety of news and updates about Flutter. We would love for you all to be part of it.

In addition to the live session, prior to the keynote, we'll give a warm-up talk about our adventures with the Google Maps flutter plugin at freiheit.com.

The event is free of charge, and everyone is invited. Registration will close at 50 attendees. You can register through here.

We will be updating this page periodically with news, schedules, and more.

Be a part of the celebration and join us in a live viewing party on December 4th!

Also, if you are interested in Flutter, please take a look at it here: https://flutter.io

View Party Schedule
17:00 Welcome
17:15 Adventures with Google Maps Flutter plugin
18:00 Keynote live stream
19:30 Continued live stream and open discussion

In case you can't join from the beginning, feel free to join later for the keynote live stream only.

events.name: Codelab Thursday - Category: Firebase
events.description:
This is the first event in a series of events where we will be doing Codelabs together.

The idea is that we meet on the last Thursday of each month and make Codelabs on a specific topic. Nobody prepares anything and we just help each other. (Most of the time something doesn't work when you install it or you can just talk directly about ambiguities)

This first time, the category should be "Firebase". At the beginning we will ask who wants to do what and then we will sit down. Everyone is invited and we are happy if there are Firebase professionals who want to support us.

Supporter: This event is kindly supported by tomorrow.one with space and drinks, who are currently looking for developers. So take a look at https://www.tomorrow.one/de-de/jobs if you want to change your career.

If you are interested in another topic for the next Codelab-Thursdays and/or a company that would like to support us, please write me personally!
events.how_to_find_us: We will be on the ground floor.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Hamburg 2019
events.description:
Hello!

Google I/O is here again! Taking place in Mountain View, it will give us insights into the newest innovations. Come join us to watch the keynote live stream, share the excitement on new products and technology announcements.

We will open the doors at 18:00 and start at 18:30 with a short introduction of the Hacker School and the sponsors and watch the Google keynote from 19:00. The keynote will last until about 20:30. After that there will be time for some drinks.

We will NOT stream the Developer Keynote at 21:45 because experience shows that 80% of people leave after the first keynote.

Please register now to secure your spot as space is limited.

We are very much looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: Flutter Intro @freiheit.com
events.description:
Flutter is a cutting edge framework from Google for developing mobile applications on iOS & Android which will be the topic of this event.

We will start this meetup with a brief overview and show cases of what we do with Flutter at freiheit.com and why we like it. Afterwards Johannes will give a more detailed introduction to Flutter to get you started.
After his talk you will know how Flutter's architecture works in general for creating high performance mobile applications. In the second part of the talk, Johannes will investigate how to build a simple Flutter application with the BloC pattern, which helps you to create mobile applications with a simple and clean architecture.

About the Speaker:
Johannes Milke is a Flutter Software Engineer from Berlin who recently graduated from FH Lübeck university with a degree in Applied Science of Information Technology and Software Engineering. In his bachelor thesis, he has focused on evaluating Flutter and developing mobile business applications for service providers and their customers.

events.name: GeoNight June 2019: Google Earth and Maps
events.description:
Next Wednesday Ubilabs organizes a great event on Google Maps/Earth with three speakers from Google in Mountain View. It's pretty crowded, but if you're interested in maps and more, you should sign up - if necessary via the waiting list.

Registrations not here, but in the event of GeoNights: https://www.meetup.com/GeoNight/events/262044033
